question: A child has a splenic mass with a mediastinal mass. He appears pale, has red eyes and suffers from recurrent infections. Possible diagnosis is -
exp: Ans. is 'a' i. e., Acute Lymphoblastic leukemia o The age group and symptoms of the child are consistent with Acute Lymphoblastic leukemia Acute. Lymphoblastic leukemiao Acute lymphoblastic leukemia (ALL) encompasses a group of neoplasms composed of immature, precursor B or T (Pre-T) lymphocytes referred to as lymphoblast. Clinical manifestations of ALLo Symptoms related to depression of normal marrow function. o An accumulation of neoplastic blast cells in the bone marrow suppresses normal hematopoisis by physical crowding and competition for growth factorso This results in: - Anemia - Fatigue, palloro Neutropenia - Infection, intermittent fevero Thrombocytopenia - Bleeding, petechiae, ecchymoses, epistaxis. o These are the most common sign & symptoms. o Bone pain and tenderness resulting from marrow expansion and infiltration of the subperiosteum. o Generalized lymphadenopathy, splenomegaly and hepatomegaly Caused by neoplastic infiltration of these tissues. More common in ALL than AML. o Symptoms related to compression of large mediastinal vessels or airway In Pre-T ALL of thymuso CNS manifestation Due to meningeal involvement. -Headache, vomiting, nerve palsies. More common in ALL than in AML. o Testicular involvement is also more common in ALL than in AML.
